channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC

item.title: Report X-2024020456
item.description:
Report X-2024020456

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: RAEFORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON ARRIVAL TO THE TERMINAL, PACKAGE WAS FOUND WET AND SMELLING STRONGLY, PUT IN A DAMAGE BIN, AND GIVEN TO THE QA TEAM FOR INSPECTION. AFTER INSPECTING, IT WAS FOUND THAT THE CANS HAD BEEN DENTED/CRUSHED ALONG WITH THE PRODUCT FROM WITH IN SEAPED OUT OF THE CANS. THE CAPS WERE ON TIGHT BUT MAY HAVE BEEN MISALIGNED. DescribePack: NO PACKAGING FAILURES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WHEN THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND, IT WAS GIVEN TO THE QA'S AND PLACED IN A DAMAGE BIN UNTIL A HAZMAT CONTAINER WAS FOUND TO CONTROL THE STRONG SMELL.

item.title: Report X-2024020440
item.description:
Report X-2024020440

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The actual sequence of events that led up to the damaged package incident is unknown, but once package had been discovered, immediate action was taken to isolate the package within the hazmat processing cage for further processing and examination. DescribePack: Two bags of granular fungicide powder had some ripping and tearing along the seams of the bag closure, which caused the leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Once package was discovered, action was taken to isolate the damaged package in the Hazmat Processing cage for further investigation and processing.

item.title: Report X-2024020279
item.description:
Report X-2024020279

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: RAEFORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded on vehicle for delivery driver saw package leaking at 11:30am and immediately placed package in plastic bag. Once driver returned to station, he turned it in to VSA to be processed accordingly. DescribePack: The cap on top of gallon did not close properly and caused it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a plastic bag inside vehicle.

DescribePack: 1 of the gallon jugs appeared to have had a loose lid causing the internal leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into hazmat tote in order to contain the spill. The lid was secured

item.description:
Report I-2024020019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: Greensboro
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the bottom side of the drum putting a 1.5 inch long puncture in the pail. Pail was then placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup 1

item.title: Report X-2024020462
item.description:
Report X-2024020462

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: LINCOLNTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler noticed a smell coming from the box and had it sent to QA area. It was not actually leaking outside of the box, but I also smelled it so I placed it in a plastic tote and moved it away from the work area until I could deal with it. DescribePack: Package was a sturdy cardboard box with a white, plastic 5.0 gal pail inside the box. The shipping box was not damaged at all but the pail was busted on the bottom and cracked all the way up the side of the pail. From the damage to the pail it appears the box was dropped or slammed down, causing the bottom to burst. The lid was still intact, still sealed , not damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spilled contents stayed confined to the box initially. The contents of the package was transferred to a Hazmat drum as soon as possible. The plastic pail and the contents had to be transferred to the Hazmat drum because there was no hazmat drum big enough for the entire box to fit into. I folded the box down ,placed in a hazmat bag and another hazmat drum.

item.title: Report I-2024100053
item.description:
Report I-2024100053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: Charlotte
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Passenger Drake Cox informed us of his laptop overheating inside of his backpack. When we got out the fire containment bag, he decided to bring the whole backpack to us. We put on the heat resistant gloves and a second Flight Attendant helped me with pouring a Iiter of water on the inside of the fire containment bag. I removed the laptop from the backpack and placed it in the fire containment bag with the battery facing down. The second Flight Attendant cleared out a galley cart and we placed the fire containment bag in the furthest aircraft right galley cart in the AFT of the aircraft. We continued to monitor the laptop throughout the rest of the flight, but no further action was needed. Once we arrived and all the passengers deplaned, the entire cart was brought to the forward galley as per the Supervisofs request and that's when the Supervisor told us Flight Attendants we were ok to leave and the rest would be taken care of. The laptop was an Apple MacBook Pro.
